dataExportOptionsDlg Module¶

class volumina.widgets.dataExportOptionsDlg.ExportOperatorABC(parent=None, graph=None)[source]¶

Bases: lazyflow.operator.Operator

The export dialog is designed to work with any operator that satisfies this ABC interface.

exportHelper Module¶

volumina.widgets.exportHelper.get_settings_and_export_layer(layer, parent_widget=None)[source]¶

Prompt the user for layer export settings, and perform the layer export.

class volumina.widgets.exportHelper.ExportHelper(parent)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtCore.QObject

Executes a layer export in the background, shows a progress dialog, and displays errors (if any).

run(opExport)[source]¶

Start the export and return immediately (after showing the progress dialog).

Parameters:opExport – The export object to execute. It must have a ‘run_export()’ method and a ‘progressSignal’ member.

subregionRoiWidget Module¶

class volumina.widgets.subregionRoiWidget.RoiSpinBox(parent, min_, max_, default)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QSpinBox

QSpinBox with a special display when it’s disabled.

setPartner(partner)[source]¶
changeEvent(event)[source]¶

Overridden from QWidget. Set special text ‘–’ when widget is disabled.

class volumina.widgets.subregionRoiWidget.SubregionRoiWidget(parent)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QTableWidget

Provides the controls for a user to specify a subregion of interest for export. If the user doesn’t specify a range for an axis, the roi we emit will include ‘None’ entries. This is useful for cases where you may be specifying a roi in multiple images of different sizes.

roiChanged¶

emit(tuple, tuple), tuples may contain ‘None’ to indicate ‘full range’

initWithExtents(axes, shape, start, stop)[source]¶
